issues.description: The signature of messageOnMilk conflicts between artifacts: the problem statement’s UML and template Main expect messageOnMilk() with no parameters, but the solution’s Milkable interface and implementing classes define messageOnMilk(double volume). This mismatch will cause compilation errors and prevents students from following the intended design.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the signature across all artifacts. Either remove the volume parameter from messageOnMilk in the solution (so it matches the no‐arg version in the UML and template), or update the problem statement and template to require a volume parameter consistently.

issues.description: The problem statement and UML define the Milkable interface method as messageOnMilk():String (no parameters), but the solution’s Milkable interface and implementations declare messageOnMilk(double volume):String. This signature mismatch will confuse students about whether they need to supply a volume parameter when milking animals.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the solution interface and implementations to define messageOnMilk() with no parameters to match the problem specification, or revise the problem statement to require a double volume parameter in messageOnMilk(double volume) consistently across all artifacts.
